vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
εὐνο-έω,
to be well-inclined or favourable, with dative, τοῖσι ἐμοῖσι πρήγμασι [Refs 5th c.BC+]; τινι [Refs 5th c.BC+]be at peace with, [NT+5th c.BC+]; ὁ εὐνοῶν one's well-wisher, [Refs 4th c.BC+]:—middle, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]:—passive, to be kindly or affectionately treated, uncertain reading in [Refs 4th c.BC+]; to be liked, ὑπὸ θεῶν καὶ ὑπὸ γυναικῶν [Refs 4th c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to settle matters by coming to terms reconcile
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to settle matters by coming to terms reconcile
to have kind thoughts, be well affected, or kindly disposed towards, make friends, settle by coming to terms with Mt. 5:25*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: reconciliarse ;  hacerse amigos, ponerse de acuerdo
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition: 有好感的, 交朋友 (太 5:25)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition: 有好感的, 交朋友 (太 5:25)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: để được thuận lợi; có thiện ý; có thiện chí; thỏa thuận  ; để được hòa bình. εὖ (G2095) + νοῦς (G3563)
